Package neuroEvo

Class NodeGene

java.lang.Object
neuroEvo.Gene
neuroEvo.NodeGene
public class NodeGene
extends Gene
This class represents the start and end points for the flow of values
NodeGenes are one of the 2 Gene types of this algorithm. There 3 types of NodeGenes, Inputs, Hidden, and Outputs. Input Nodes contain user-defined values, Hidden Nodes contain intermediate values seen only by the network , and Output Nodes contain the final values of the network which are given back to the user.
The values of Hidden and Output nodes are based on the sum of their input Connections Weights multiplied by their respective source Node values
This process is called Forward Propagation and is equivalent to the Neural Network process of the same name
Author:
Caleb Devon
Created 7/11/2021

  • Constructor Details

    • NodeGene

      protected NodeGene​(int innovNum, double x)
      Used for Input and Output Nodes
      Parameters:
      innovNum - The unique identification number given to this NodeGene
      x - Important for maintaining a proper linear flow (Input Node x = 0.0, Output Node x = 1.0)

    • NodeGene

      protected NodeGene​(ConnectionGene split, double x)
      Used for Hidden Nodes
      Parameters:
      split - The original Connection that was split when creating this Node
      x - Important for maintaining a proper linear flow (Input Node x = 0.0, Output Node x = 1.0)

      Hidden Nodes are created by splitting a Connection in half, and placing a Node with an input and output connection its place, maintaining the original path.
      The originally split ConnectionGene is saved in the new Node, and is used to determine equivalence among 2 Nodes

  • Method Details

    • reset

      protected void reset​(boolean resetOrg)
      Empties this Node's list of input and output ConnectionGenes
      Parameters:
      resetOrg - If this is true, the Node's Original Connections (only exists on Hidden Nodes) will also be reset Used when breeding to carryover the NodeGene without the ConnectionGenes attached to it

    • known

      protected boolean known​(Gene other)
      Description copied from class: Gene
      This method is used for determining whether a newly created Gene is the first of its kind, or was already discovered in previous Genomes
      Specified by:
      known in class Gene
      Parameters:
      other - This is the Gene being compared to
      Returns:
      Returns true if the Gene is equivalent to the 'other' Gene

      Unlike the "equals" method, the "known" method compares internal variables to determine equivalence. The reason for this separation is that although the "equals" method may be easier to use, not all Genes will have their Innovation Numbers initialized before being compared.
